commandsParsing

Class DomainParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • commandsParsing.DomainParser

  • public class DomainParser
extends java.lang.Object
    This class parse domain and check if is in valid format.
    Author:
    Martin Holecek

      private boolean checkBrackets(java.lang.String input)
      Check if the IP brackets are in valid form and if there are not double dots ("..") syntaxes

      Check if input string contains only alphanumeric values (a-z, A-Z, 0-9).

      Check if domain has valid format (numbers, dotted numbers or name)
      private boolean isDottedNumber(java.lang.String input)
      Check if string is in dotted ("X.X.X.X") number format (4 bytes - IP address) which is "dotnum" in RFC specification
      private boolean isNameValid(java.lang.String input)
      Check if each "name" (symbol from RFC) is valid format (page 29 in RFC 821)
      boolean isNumber(java.lang.String input)
      Check if the input string can be parsed to number

      • isDomainValid

        public boolean isDomainValid(java.lang.String domain)
        Check if domain has valid format (numbers, dotted numbers or name)
        Parameters:
        domain - name
        Returns:
        true if domain is valid otherwise false

      • isDottedNumber

        private boolean isDottedNumber(java.lang.String input)
        Check if string is in dotted ("X.X.X.X") number format (4 bytes - IP address) which is "dotnum" in RFC specification
        Parameters:
        input - is a string which must contain dotted number (IP address format)
        Returns:
        true if is valid dotted number, else return false

      • isNumber

        public boolean isNumber(java.lang.String input)
        Check if the input string can be parsed to number
        Parameters:
        input - is string must be digits between 0-9
        Returns:
        true if is number otherwise false

      • isNameValid

        private boolean isNameValid(java.lang.String input)
        Check if each "name" (symbol from RFC) is valid format (page 29 in RFC 821)
        Parameters:
        input - is string
        Returns:
        true if is in valid format, otherwise false

      • isAlphanumeric

        public boolean isAlphanumeric(java.lang.String input)
        Check if input string contains only alphanumeric values (a-z, A-Z, 0-9).
        Parameters:
        input - string
        Returns:
        true if input does contain only alphanumerics (a-z, A-Z, 0-9)

      • checkBrackets

        private boolean checkBrackets(java.lang.String input)
        Check if the IP brackets are in valid form and if there are not double dots ("..") syntaxes

        Returns:
